AutoLoad.About: This field indicates the loading policy of new data. It describes what data should be in memory at all times (e.g: everything from today, the coming week and yesterday). If someone needs a query for next month, that'll be loaded too - but they'll have to wait till the server has built that cache
AutoLoad.About:TimeBefore: When a cache update is run, the current date will be taken, rounded down (so that date % reloadEvery == 0) and then be used to calculate the time window. This start of this window is (date - timeBefore). Time in seconds.
AutoLoad.About:TimeAfter: When a cache update is run, the current date will be taken, rounded down (so that date % reloadEvery == 0) and then be used to calculate the time window. This end of this window is (date + timeAfter). Time in seconds.
AutoLoad.About:IntervalSplit: Loading days worth of data takes a while. As not to wait minutes to start querying, loading the data is split in smaller parts of max 'IntervalSplit'-seconds
AutoLoad.About:ReloadEvery: Trigger a cache refresh every 'ReloadEvery' seconds
